Class DownloadInstructions.Instructions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadInstructions.Instructions

    public abstract static class DownloadInstructions.Instructions
extends java.lang.Object
implements BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
    Enables the bitmap downloader to know on how to handle a command.

    2009.03.04

      • hasLocalBitmap

        public final DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap hasLocalBitmap(DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                                                   java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                                   java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        The method will be invoked, so as to known whether the bitmap could not be extracted locally, i.e. from the application .apk, or a static local resource.

        Do not use that placeholder for introducing any persistent strategy, but use the BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions.getInputStream(String, Object, String, BasisDownloadInstructions.InputStreamDownloadInstructor) and BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions.onInputStreamDownloaded(String, Object, String, InputStream) methods instead, for that purpose.

        Specified by:
        hasLocalBitmap in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
        Parameters:
        view - the View the command should be executed against: cannot be null
        Returns:
        true if and only the bitmap should be taken locally, instead of running into the downloading process: in that case, the Instructions#onBindLocalBitmap(View, String, Object) will be invoked
        See Also:
        #onBindLocalBitmap(Viewable, String, Object)

      • onBindLocalBitmap

        public final void onBindLocalBitmap(DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                     DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap bitmap,
                     java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                     java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        When a local bitmap usage has been specified, is responsible for binding the view with that local bitmap.

        It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

        Specified by:
        onBindLocalBitmap in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
        bitmap - the bitmap which has previously returned from the #hasTemporaryBitmap(String, Object) method, if not null
        See Also:
        #hasLocalBitmap(String, Object)

      • hasTemporaryBitmap

        public final DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap hasTemporaryBitmap(DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                                                       java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                                       java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Enables to determine whether a temporary bitmap (which will be eventually a final bound bitmap if the case the provided bitmapUid is null) should be bound to the underlying view.

        The method will be invoked even with a bitmapUid set to null, but not if the CoreBitmapDownloader#get(Viewable, String, Object, com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadContracts.Handlerable, Instructions) is invoked with a first argument set to null. Note that the method is granted to be invoked from the UI thread, unless the CoreBitmapDownloader#get(boolean, boolean, Viewable, String, Object, com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadContracts.Handlerable, Instructions) is invoked with a first argument set to true.

        Specified by:
        hasTemporaryBitmap in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
        Parameters:
        view - the View the command should be executed against: cannot be null
        Returns:
        a non-null bitmap if and only if a temporary bitmap should be used for the underlying view: in that case, the Instructions#onBindTemporaryBitmap(View, String, Object) will be invoked with this provided returned valued
        See Also:
        #onBindTemporaryBitmap(Viewable, Bitmapable, String, Object)

      • onBindTemporaryBitmap

        public final void onBindTemporaryBitmap(DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                         DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap bitmap,
                         java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                         java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        When a temporary bitmap usage has been specified, is responsible for binding the view with that temporary bitmap.

        The method will be invoked even with a bitmapUid set to null.

        It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

        Specified by:
        onBindTemporaryBitmap in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
        bitmap - the bitmap which has previously returned from the #hasTemporaryBitmap(String, Object) method, if not null
        See Also:
        #hasTemporaryBitmap(String, Object)

      • onBitmapReady

        public final void onBitmapReady(boolean allright,
                 DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                 DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap bitmap,
                 java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                 java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Is invoked every time, once the underlying view bitmap is either not null ready in memory (the allright parameter is set to true), or when it occurs that the bitmap could not be downloaded or is not well formed (the allright parameter is set to false).

        It is NOT ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

        Specified by:
        onBitmapReady in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
        Parameters:
        allright - indicates whether the bitmap is actually available and well formed
        view - will be null if, and only if the provided View is null
        bitmap - cannot be null if and only if allright is true

      • onBindBitmap

        public final boolean onBindBitmap(boolean downloaded,
                   DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                   DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap bitmap,
                   java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                   java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Is invoked once the bitmap is ready when the provided View is not null, whether it has been downloaded from Internet or retrieved from the cache.

        It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

        Specified by:
        onBindBitmap in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
        Parameters:
        downloaded - indicates whether the bitmap has actually been downloaded from the network or retrieved locally
        bitmap - will never be null
        Returns:
        false if and only if the current instance did not perform the binding

      • onBitmapBound

        public final void onBitmapBound(boolean result,
                 DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                 java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                 java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        This is the last callback that will invoked during the binding process, provided it is still required that a binding should occur (i.e. that no new binding command has not been stacked for the same view in the meantime). It is invoked once the given the bitmap identifier, its specifications and either:
        • the underlying bitmap has actually been downloaded, and attached to its View,
        • or the underlying bitmap has actually been bound to its View from a local resource,
        • or, the underlying bitmap download was a failure (wrong or null bitmap URL, connectivity problem).

        The method will be invoked even with a bitmapUid set to null.

        It is ensured that this notification will be invoked from the GUI thread.

        Specified by:
        onBitmapBound in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
        Parameters:
        result - true if and only if the bitmap has actually been downloaded and attached to its view
